intro: Troximon virginicum, commonly known as the Virginia thistle, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces showy purple to pink flower heads that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape, contributing to its ornamental value.
